meanings.definition: Having a decorative molding at the top of a building or structure.
meanings.sent1: The corniced house looked elegant with its fancy roof trim.
meanings.sent2: The architect designed a corniced entrance for the grand mansion.
meanings.sent3: The corniced roof made the building stand out in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent4: Her cake was corniced with intricate icing designs.
meanings.sent5: The corniced balcony added charm to the old building.

meanings.definition: To furnish or finish with a cornice.
meanings.sent1: They corniced the windows to give them a polished look.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter will cornice the door frames in the new house.
meanings.sent3: He corniced the bookshelf with colorful paper for a fun touch.
meanings.sent4: She corniced the mirror with a golden frame to match the decor.
meanings.sent5: The artist corniced the painting with a beautiful wooden border.

meanings.definition: The topmost projecting part of an entablature.
meanings.sent1: The ancient temple had a majestic corniced structure.
meanings.sent2: The museum displayed a piece of the original corniced entablature.
meanings.sent3: The corniced edge of the building caught the sunlight perfectly.
meanings.sent4: The corniced detail on the architecture was truly impressive.
meanings.sent5: Visitors admired the intricate design of the corniced entablature.
